text: the most beautiful thing I've ever seen in my entire life was criss-crossing rainbows that went on for about three miles the colors were so vivid and the sky was so clear it was just
unbelievable I've lived with diabetic retinopathy as a person who is now legally blind for over 30 years I was coming down this one lane road on
the hill and the minute I pulled out onto the roadway there was a massive hemorrhage in one eye it was instant I completely lost the sight in that eye it was like somebody had shot red ink into
my eye and it was just swirling swirling swirling until it was so thick you know I couldn't see through it you know it was a shock because I had had diabetes for 20 years and never had any problems
at all and then all of a sudden this happened and I'm like oh my god you know what's going on I was not thinking down the road oh my gosh I want to be totally blind and I never went there
the way diabetic retinopathy has impacted my life has been having to learn new ways to do almost everything you're thinking how am I going to do this and how am I going to do that
what's going to happen to my job how I cook how am I going to know that if I'm matching my clothing right don't ever say this could never happen to me because 45% of old adults with
diabetes have retinopathy die you take blindness six get your eyes checked every year you
